page.title: 14W.I./Tollerton Show
page.content: recreational and educational body. Members wear a special badge.At monthly meetings members listen to speakers or watch demonstrations.The Tollerton W.I.raises money through musical evenings.The money is used to help old people in various ways.Meals on wheels are delivered from the village school once a week.Members help at Tollerton Show.The annual subscription is Â£4.Members attend meetings at County and National level. Tollerton Show dates from Medieval Times when on September 5th 1256, King Henry 111 granted a charter to John Mauncel, Treasurer of York Minster, and his successors that they should have for ever at Tollerton, a market every week on Wednesday, and a fair yearly to be held for three days. On the eve, the day and the morrow of the feast of the Assumption of the Virgin
